content.description: A steep arete problem with powerful moves and some really cool holds. The crux revolves around getting to and moving off of the jug in the middle of the climb.
content.location: From Do-Bop, keep walking away from the road on an overgrown trail and the problem will be facing you. You can see the problem from Do-Bop. GPS Coordinates 37.7207, -119.6422

content.description:
A unique and classic problem.

Stand start and head up the crack using painful 1-digit locks and tiny crimps. A nearly-footless traverse on edges leads to better holds below the lip. Getting up to and over the lip is intimidating but not difficult.

Warning:

There is no downclimb off this boulder. Have a rope and harness ready; there's a bolt with a quick link next to the mantel. Another more terrifying option could be to reverse the mantel and drop off.
content.location:
Follow directions for

Lower Cathedral Boulders

. The path goes straight to a big cluster of boulders; Do-Bop is facing away from the road.
